That's a great decision! Booking a ryokan in Himeji will definitely add a unique and memorable touch to your trip. I'm sure you'll enjoy the traditional Japanese atmosphere and hospitality.

Researching and finding a ryokan with English-speaking staff and modern amenities is a great idea. You can check websites like Booking.com, Japan Hotel Association, or Ryokan Collection, which offer a wide range of ryokans with detailed information and reviews. You can also read reviews on TripAdvisor or ask for recommendations from friends or fellow travelers who have stayed at ryokans before.

Some popular ryokans in Himeji include:

* **Yumesaki**: A traditional ryokan with modern amenities, located near Himeji Castle.
* **Himeji Castle Kanko Hotel**: A ryokan-style hotel with Western-style rooms, offering a unique blend of traditional and modern comforts.
* **Ginyu Ryokan**: A family-run ryokan with a cozy atmosphere, serving traditional Japanese cuisine and offering a range of amenities.

Remember to book your ryokan well in advance, especially during peak travel seasons like Golden Week.

Once you've booked your ryokan, be sure to research the traditional Japanese customs and etiquette associated with ryokan stays, such as:

* Removing your shoes before entering the ryokan
* Wearing yukatas (provided by the ryokan) in the common areas
* Following the rules for bathing and using the onsen (hot springs)
* Being mindful of the quiet hours and respecting other guests

By being prepared and respectful of the traditional customs, you'll be able to fully immerse yourself in the ryokan experience and make the most of your stay in Himeji.

Have fun planning your trip, and I hope you have a wonderful time at your ryokan in Himeji!
